content.description: Starting the climb is the hardest and then coming over the bulge.
content.location: This is the rightmost bolted route on the main part of the face, about twenty feet left of the detached pinnacle of rock that sticks out from the wall.

content.description: The first route climbed on the cliff! Tough moves pulling a bulge and traversing beneath a roof down low leading to a much easier climbing above.
content.protection: Best as a Top rope. There is a single bolt on the back wall at the top of the cliff, which can be back up by threading a little handle in the rock with some webbing or cord. Anchor should be extended to avoid rope damage. Leading as trad is possible although I wouldn't trust the grungy crack to hold you.
content.location: Follows the crack about 15' to the left of the large detached pillar and dirty gully on the southern side of the crag. Anchor (single bolt) can be found by following the hiking trail around the south side of the false summit (north side passes a bee hive!) and around just past a few palo verde trees on the back wall.

content.description: The route is located to the right of a noticeable crack, on the right half of the wall. Climb out of a short right-facing corner, through a small overhang, and onto the face. The runout before the second bolt can be dangerous, and the first bolt isn't very low, either!

content.location: Route is to the far left of the wall just to the right of Double Feature ( 10+ ).

content.description: The best route on the mountain. Start up a ramp past one bolt to the overhanging business. Finish gets easier.
content.location:
Up the most obvious part of the overhanging area. 

  Beta for this route and others can be found on the 'Lookout Mountain' $5 foldout guide sold by Marty Karabin at the Phoenix Rock Gym or at local outdoor outlets.

content.description: The start is loose class 4 to a short two bolt, slightly overhanging face. Plenty to grab on to.
content.protection: Quickdraws are sufficient. Two bolts to a two bolt anchor. The anchor can be backed up with bolts of 'The Gnome' to the right and one ledge up on the cliff if toproping.
content.location: The left-most route on the cliff. You can spot the hangers spray painted white for this route and The Gnome as you round the corner. The anchors can be tough to find from above if setting up a top rope. If you take the use trail to the notch with the memorial plaque and drop down to the north, you can usually find the larger eye-bolt and two rap rings for the Gnome, with the anchors for this a bit further down the loose slope.

content.description: Scramble up class 4 up right two a headwall with two bolts and a large eyebolt anchor. Two adjacent anchors to the right for rappelling the route, or can be incorporated into the anchor with some long cordage.
content.location: The second left-most route on the cliff. You can spot the hangers spray painted white for this route and Loose Lieback as you round the corner on the approach trail. The anchors can be tough to find from above if setting up a top rope. If you take the use trail to the notch with the memorial plaque and drop down to the north, you can usually find the larger eye-bolt and two rap rings above the route. These anchors are lower down the ledges compared to others on the cliff.

content.description: Balancy moves.  Loose start on steep  rock.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Shared anchors with The Contender.

content.description: 2 roofs at the start then some face moves to 2 bolt anchor
content.location: To Climbers left of Devil in Disguise

content.description: A stiff roof leads to easy climbing
content.location: Climbers left of Totally Trad.  3rd bolted route to the left of broken pillar.

content.description: Pull a roof to start then face climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor...shares anchor with Falling Stars

content.description: The rock here is basalt, probably not as perfect as what you will see at Paradise Forks, but if you are looking for an after work route this is a good place to come to.  Routes range from 5.7 to 5.11.  The belays are a little steep so make sure you don't fall before the first bolt, you will need a spotter.
